```{r yearly data summaries}
#examine by year; source method: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2127926/how-do-i-highlight-an-observations-bin-in-a-histogram-in-r
highlight <- function(x, value1, value2, col.value1, col.value2, col=NA, ...){
    hst <- hist(x, ...)
    idx1 <- findInterval(value1, hst$breaks)
    idx2 <- findInterval(value2, hst$breaks)
    cols <- rep(col, length(hst$counts))
    cols[idx1] <- col.value1
    cols[idx2] <- col.value2
    hist(x, col=cols, ...)
}

ordered <- Sz08to16[with(Sz08to16, order(Unlinked_ID, datetime)), ]
#weeks are funny at the start and end of the year with partial weeks, so remove them
orderednotails <- ordered[which(epiweek(ordered$datetime) > 1 & epiweek(ordered$datetime) < 52),"datetime"]
summary(epiweek(orderednotails))

for(i in min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)):max(year(Sz08to16$datetime))) {
    DSTon <- as.Date(ymd(paste(i,3,01,sep="-")))
    DSTon <- as.Date(ifelse(wday(DSTon)==1,DSTon+7,DSTon+(15-wday(DSTon))))
    DSToff <- as.Date(ymd(paste(i,11,01,sep="-")))
    DSToff <- as.Date(ifelse(wday(DSToff)==1,DSToff,DSToff+(8-wday(DSToff))))
    #Szwks <- epiweek(ordered[which(year(ordered$datetime)==i),"datetime"])
    #highlight(Szwks,epiweek(DSTon),epiweek(DSToff),"red","blue",breaks=week(as.POSIXct(paste(i,12,31,sep="-"))),main=paste("Histogram of seizure counts for ",i,sep=""))
    Szwks <- epiweek(orderednotails[which(year(orderednotails)==i)])
    highlight(Szwks,
              epiweek(DSTon),
              epiweek(DSToff),
              "red",
              "blue",
              breaks=51,
              main=paste("Histogram of seizure counts for ",i,sep=""))
}
```

Calculate Z-scores and percentile for DST seizure mean using the whole of population data as the "normative baseline"  
```{r zscore comparisons and independent t-tests comparing DST to any non-DST baseline weekday}
dailypercentiles <- data.frame("Weekday"=character(),
                               "MeanPercentile"=numeric(),
                               "PercentileSD"=numeric(),
                               stringsAsFactors = F)
sigdf <- data.frame("Weekday"=character(),
                    "p"=numeric(),
                    "p.signif"=character(),
                    stringsAsFactors = F)
percentalls <- data.frame("Year"=numeric(),
                          "Percentile"=numeric(),
                          "Weekday"=character(),
                          stringsAsFactors = F)
yearlist <- c(min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)):max(year(Sz08to16$datetime))) #Bound years by the bounds of the dataset
list <- c("Sunday","Monday","Tuesday","Wednesday","Thursday","Friday","Saturday")
index=1
for(i in list) {
    yearlyDSTdf <- data.frame("Year"=numeric(),
                              "PopMean"=numeric(),
                              "PopSD"=numeric(),
                              "SzCount"=numeric(),
                              "Zscore"=numeric(),
                              "Percentile"=numeric())
    counter=1
    for(j in yearlist) {
        daymean <- mean(table(as.Date(Sz08to16[which(Sz08to16$wkday == i & year(Sz08to16$datetime) == j),"datetime"])))
        yearlyDSTdf[counter,"PopMean"] <- daymean
        daysd <- sd(table(as.Date(Sz08to16[which(Sz08to16$wkday == i & year(Sz08to16$datetime) == j),"datetime"])))
        yearlyDSTdf[counter,"PopSD"] <- daysd
        yearlyDSTdf[counter,"Year"] <- j
        yearlyDSTdf[counter,"SzCount"] <- table(as.Date(Sz08to16wkofDST[which(Sz08to16wkofDST$wkday == i & year(Sz08to16wkofDST$datetime) == j),"datetime"]))[[1]]
        yearlyDSTdf[counter,"Zscore"] <- (yearlyDSTdf[counter,"SzCount"] - daymean)/daysd
        yearlyDSTdf[counter,"Percentile"] <- round(pnorm(yearlyDSTdf[counter,"Zscore"])*100,2)
        counter=counter+1
    }
    FORtall <- yearlyDSTdf[,c("Year","Percentile")]
    FORtall$Weekday <- i
    percentalls <- rbind(percentalls,FORtall)
    write.table(yearlyDSTdf,
                file = paste(i,"yearly percentiles.txt"),
                quote = F,
                row.names = F)
    
    dailypercentiles[index,"Weekday"] <- i
    dailypercentiles[index,"MeanPercentile"] <- mean(yearlyDSTdf$Percentile)
    dailypercentiles[index,"PercentileSD"] <- sd(yearlyDSTdf$Percentile)/sqrt(max(year(Sz08to16$datetime))-min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)))
    
    sigdf[index,"Weekday"] <- i
    #sigdf[index,"p"] <- round(t.test(table(as.Date(firstweek[which(firstweek$wkday == i),"datetime"])),
    #                                 table(as.Date(secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == i),"datetime"])))[["p.value"]],4)
    sigdf[index,"p"] <- round(t.test(table(as.Date(Sz08to16wkofDST[which(Sz08to16wkofDST$wkday == i),"datetime"])),
                                     table(as.Date(Sz08to16notDST[which(Sz08to16notDST$wkday == i),"datetime"])))[["p.value"]],4)
    if(sigdf[index,"p"]<0.05 & sigdf[index,"p"]>0.01) {
        sigdf[index,"p.signif"] <- "*"
    } else if(sigdf[index,"p"]<0.01 & sigdf[index,"p"]>0.001) {
        sigdf[index,"p.signif"] <- "**"
    } else if(sigdf[index,"p"]<0.001) {
        sigdf[index,"p.signif"] <- "***"
    } else {
        sigdf[index,"p.signif"] <- "ns"
    }
    
    index=index+1
}
dailypercentiles$Weekday <- factor(dailypercentiles$Weekday, levels = dailypercentiles$Weekday) #ensures weekdays stay in order Sun-Sat
dailypercentiles
factorlevels <- factor(list,levels=list)
percentalls$Weekday <- factor(percentalls$Weekday, levels=factorlevels) #ensures weekdays stay in order Sun-Sat
```

```{r percentile trends over the year}
percentiletrends <- data.frame("Year"=numeric(),
                               "RelativeDay"=numeric(),
                               "Zscore"=numeric(),
                               "Percentile"=numeric(),
                               "AtRisk"=numeric())
yearlist <- c(min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)):max(year(Sz08to16$datetime)))
Szper <- Sz08to16[,c("datetime","DSTday","FreqperDAY","AtRiskperDAY")]
Szper$RelativeDay <- yday(Szper$datetime)-Szper$DSTday
Szper$Date <- as.Date(Szper$datetime)
Szper <- Szper[,-1]
Szper <- unique(Szper)
dim(Szper) #9*365 + 3 leap days
for(i in yearlist){
    yearmean <- mean(Szper[which(year(Szper$Date) == i),"FreqperDAY"])
    yearsd <- sd(Szper[which(year(Szper$Date) == i),"FreqperDAY"])
    forptrend <- data.frame("Year"=i,
                            "RelativeDay"=Szper[which(year(Szper$Date) == i),"RelativeDay"],
                            "AtRisk"=Szper[which(year(Szper$Date) == i),"AtRiskperDAY"],
                            "Zscore"=(Szper[which(year(Szper$Date) == i),"FreqperDAY"]-yearmean)/yearsd,
                            "Percentile"=pnorm((Szper[which(year(Szper$Date) == i),"FreqperDAY"]-yearmean)/yearsd)*100)
    percentiletrends <- rbind(percentiletrends,forptrend)
}

#Now that have calculated percentiles per year, only take days that have representation over all years 2008-2016

fulldays <- as.data.frame(table(percentiletrends$RelativeDay))

percentiletrends <- percentiletrends[which(percentiletrends$RelativeDay %in% fullindex),]
```

#It's worthwhile to attempt standardization by approximate incidence (through gross estimates of at-risk population)  
```{r pseudostandardized incidence rates per day}
#This will add in the relevant data incidence data, based on an approximation of unique, at-risk individuals
# -note this denominator of person-time is inaccurate for multiple reasons:
#  +it counts people "at risk" only if they've documented a seizure - i.e. ascertainment bias for those reporting
#  +it doesn't account for single documenters that then stop using the app - also an ascertainment bias
#  +it doesn't account for interventions (i.e. surgery, changes in regimen), assuming similar risk over similar time periods
#  +it doesn't account for "voyeurs" - people who signed up, but haven't documented yet

###=====This one takes a little while to run=====###
for(j in 1:nrow(weekdANOVA)) {
    denomdf <- Sz08to16[which(Sz08to16$datetime <= as.Date(weekdANOVA[j,"Date"])),"Unlinked_ID"]
    weekdANOVA[j,"AtRisk"] <- length(unique(denomdf))
    weekdANOVA[j,"Incidence"] <- weekdANOVA[j,"Freq"]/length(unique(denomdf))
}
###=====This one takes a little while to run=====###

p <- ggplot() 
for(i in min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)):max(year(Sz08to16$datetime))) {
    p <- p + geom_boxplot(data=weekdANOVA[which(weekdANOVA[,"Year"] == i),],
                 aes(x=wkday, y=Incidence),
                 fill=brewer.pal(n=(max(year(Sz08to16$datetime))-min(year(Sz08to16$datetime))),"Paired")[i-2007],
                 alpha=0.2,
                 outlier.size=-1, #Avoid duplicate outlier plotting
                 notch = T, #Enhance visibility
                 na.rm=T)
    p <- p + geom_jitter(data=weekdANOVA[which(weekdANOVA[,"Year"] == i),],
                aes(x=wkday,y=Incidence),
                color=brewer.pal(n=(max(year(Sz08to16$datetime))-min(year(Sz08to16$datetime))),"Paired")[i-2007],
                position=position_jitter(width=0.05),
                alpha=0.8,
                na.rm=T)#Outliers from incomplete weeks
}
p <- p + 
    ylim((mean(weekdANOVA$Incidence,na.rm=T)-2*sd(weekdANOVA$Incidence,na.rm=T)),(mean(weekdANOVA$Incidence,na.rm=T)+2*sd(weekdANOVA$Incidence,na.rm=T))) + 
    xlab("Weekday") +
    ylab("Weekly seizure incidence rates (seizures per persons at risk)") +
    ggtitle("Weekly seizure incidence trends, by day of the week, separated by year") + 
    theme_bw()
p
print(p)

#That was a little messy, but it looks like the yearly pattern may be there, so plot them (and do ANOVA) separately
```

Seizure incidence rate ratios (approximated, as different denominators of person-time)  
```{r rate ratio trends}
#Because first (1st) and last weeks (52nd or 53rd) can be partial weeks, will remove so as not to bias averages for given weekdays
trending <- Sz08to16[which(Sz08to16$weeknum > 1 & Sz08to16$weeknum < 52),]
daytrend <- data.frame("Year"=year(trending$datetime),
                       "RelativeDay"=(yday(trending$datetime) - trending$DSTday),
                       "DailyIncidence"=trending$IncidenceperDAY,
                       "AtRisk"=trending$AtRiskperDAY)
#Calculate approximate "rate ratio" relative to DST
for(i in min(daytrend$Year):max(daytrend$Year)) {
    DSTinc <- mean(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == 0 & daytrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"])
    #Even though getting mean DST incidence, it can be verified that it's the same for any year: 
    print(summary(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == 0 & daytrend$Year == i),]))
    daytrend[which(daytrend$Year == i),"RateRatio"] <- daytrend[which(daytrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"]/DSTinc
}

#Because each representation at a given day of the year contains the same incidence for that day, need to remove duplicates before removing outliers (can verify by checking dim of daytrend after outlier removal if unique is done before or after the outlier removal)
daytrend <- unique(daytrend)
#Eliminate spuriously extreme outliers (beyond 1st/99th percentiles)
daytrend <- daytrend[which(daytrend$RateRatio > quantile(daytrend$RateRatio, 0.01, na.rm=T)[[1]] & daytrend$RateRatio < quantile(daytrend$RateRatio, 0.99, na.rm=T)[[1]]),]
daystats <- data.frame("RelativeDay"=numeric(),
                       "Mean"=numeric(),
                       "SD"=numeric())

###PREVIOUS METHOD without weighted averages and SDs
#index=1
#for(i in min(daytrend$RelativeDay):max(daytrend$RelativeDay)) {
#    daystats[index,"RelativeDay"] <- i
#    daystats[index,"Mean"] <- mean(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"])
#    daystats[index,"SD"] <- sd(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"])
#    index=index+1
#}

index=1
for(i in min(daytrend$RelativeDay):max(daytrend$RelativeDay)) {
    daystats[index,"RelativeDay"] <- i
    #Creating a weighted average and weighted SD
    WA <- weighted.mean(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"], daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"])
    daystats[index,"Mean"] <- WA
    WSD <- sqrt(sum(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"] * (daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"] - WA)^2)/sum(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"]))
    daystats[index,"SD"] <- WSD
    index=index+1
}
```

Individual-seizure-propensity-adusted seizure incidence rate ratios (approximated, as different denominators of person-time)  
```{r rate ratio trends - adjusted for individual yearly seizure counts}
#Because first (1st) and last weeks (52nd or 53rd) can be partial weeks, will remove so as not to bias averages for given weekdays
reltrend <- Sz08to16[which(Sz08to16$weeknum > 1 & Sz08to16$weeknum < 52),]
daytrend <- data.frame("Year"=year(reltrend$datetime),
                       "RelativeDay"=(yday(reltrend$datetime) - reltrend$DSTday),
                       "DailyIncidence"=reltrend$relIncidenceperDAY,
                       "AtRisk"=reltrend$AtRiskperDAY)
dayagg <- data.frame("Year"=numeric(),
                     "RelativeDay"=numeric(),
                     "DailyIncidence"=numeric(),
                     "RateRatio"=numeric())

#Calculate approximate "rate ratio" relative to DST
index=1
for(i in min(daytrend$Year):max(daytrend$Year)) {
    DSTinc <- mean(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == 0 & daytrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"])
    daytrend[which(daytrend$Year == i),"RateRatio"] <- daytrend[which(daytrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"]/DSTinc
    #This loop is to integrate the individual-adjusted, per-person incidences into an aggregated incidence over the time period (1 day), separately for each year. Recall the individual-adjusted, per-person incidence is each individual's seizure, divided by their yearly seizure count, then divided by the person-time at risk, but in reality this is just divided by the number at risk in that time window (because the time frame will be the same and drop out when calculating the Rate Ratios). So, because each person has a different individually-adjusted incidence, an aggregate measure is made from the mean of the individual-adjusted incidences, for each time window (ie, 1 day), and then a Rate Ratio is calculated with respect to the individual-adjusted, DST incidence.
    for(j in min(daytrend$RelativeDay):max(daytrend$RelativeDay)) {
        dayagg[index,"Year"] <- i
        dayagg[index,"RelativeDay"] <- j
        dayagg[index,"DailyIncidence"] <- mean(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == j & daytrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"])
        dayagg[index,"RateRatio"] <- mean(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == j & daytrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"])/DSTinc
        index <- index + 1
    }
}

#Eliminate spuriously extreme outliers (beyond 1st/99th percentiles)
daytrend <- daytrend[which(daytrend$RateRatio > quantile(daytrend$RateRatio, 0.01, na.rm=T)[[1]] & daytrend$RateRatio < quantile(daytrend$RateRatio, 0.99, na.rm=T)[[1]]),]
dayagg <- dayagg[which(dayagg$RateRatio > quantile(dayagg$RateRatio, 0.01, na.rm=T)[[1]] & dayagg$RateRatio < quantile(dayagg$RateRatio, 0.99, na.rm=T)[[1]]),]
forstats <- unique(daytrend[order( daytrend[,1], daytrend[,2] ),-c(3,5)]) #Removes DailyIncidence & Rate Ratio
forstats <- merge.data.frame(dayagg, forstats, na.last=NA)
forstats <- forstats[order( forstats[,1], forstats[,2] ),]
daystats <- data.frame("RelativeDay"=numeric(),
                       "Mean"=numeric(),
                       "SD"=numeric())
###PREVIOUS METHOD without weighted averages and SDs
#index=1
#for(i in min(daytrend$RelativeDay):max(daytrend$RelativeDay)) {
#    daystats[index,"RelativeDay"] <- i
#    daystats[index,"Mean"] <- mean(dayagg[which(dayagg$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"])
#    daystats[index,"SD"] <- sd(dayagg[which(dayagg$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"])
#    index=index+1
#}

index=1
for(i in min(forstats$RelativeDay):max(forstats$RelativeDay)) {
    daystats[index,"RelativeDay"] <- i
    #Creating a weighted average and weighted SD
    WA <- weighted.mean(forstats[which(forstats$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"], forstats[which(forstats$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"])
    daystats[index,"Mean"] <- WA
    WSD <- sqrt(sum(forstats[which(forstats$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"] * (forstats[which(forstats$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"] - WA)^2)/sum(forstats[which(forstats$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"]))
    daystats[index,"SD"] <- WSD
    index=index+1
}
```

```{r rate ratio trends - scaled for individual yearly seizure counts}
list <- c("Sunday","Monday","Tuesday","Wednesday","Thursday","Friday","Saturday")
week2weekstats <- data.frame("Weekday"=character(),
                             "RateRatio"=numeric(),
                             "lCI"=numeric(),
                             "uCI"=numeric(),
                             "RRP"=numeric(),
                             "RRT"=numeric(),
                             "RRdf"=numeric(),
                             "RRd"=numeric(),
                             stringsAsFactors = F)
counter=1
for(i in list) {
    uDTS1 <- uDTS[which(uDTS$RelativeDay >= 0 & uDTS$RelativeDay < 7),]
    uDTS2 <- uDTS[which(uDTS$RelativeDay >= -7 & uDTS$RelativeDay < 0),]
    #rate1 <- uDTS1[which(uDTS1$Weekday == i),c("Year","DailyIncidence")] #mistakenly adjusting day of week...need to stably reference to DST
    rate1 <- uDTS1[which(uDTS1$RelativeDay == 0),c("Year","DailyIncidence")]
    rate1 <- rate1[order(rate1$Year),]
    rate2 <- uDTS2[which(uDTS2$Weekday == i),c("Year","DailyIncidence")]
    rate2 <- rate2[order(rate2$Year),]
    RR <- rate1$DailyIncidence/rate2$DailyIncidence
    wts1 <- uDTS1[which(uDTS1$Weekday == i),c("Year","AtRisk")]
    wts1 <- wts1[order(wts1$Year),]
    wts2 <- uDTS2[which(uDTS2$Weekday == i),c("Year","AtRisk")]
    wts2 <- wts2[order(wts2$Year),]
    wt.mean(RR,wts2$AtRisk)
    week2weekstats[counter,"Weekday"] <- i
    week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"] <- wt.mean(RR,wts2$AtRisk)
    week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"lCI"] <- wt.mean(RR,wts2$AtRisk)-1.96*wt.sd(RR,wts2$AtRisk)/sqrt(nrow(rate2))
    week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"uCI"] <- wt.mean(RR,wts2$AtRisk)+1.96*wt.sd(RR,wts2$AtRisk)/sqrt(nrow(rate2))
    baselinerisk <- rep(1,nrow(rate1))
    weightedT <- wtd.t.test(RR,baselinerisk,wts2$AtRisk,wts1$AtRisk)
    week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RRT"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[1]]
    week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RRdf"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[2]]
    week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RRP"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[3]]
    print(weightedT)
    CohenD <- cohen.d(RR,baselinerisk)
    week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RRd"] <- CohenD$estimate[[1]]
    print(CohenD)
    counter=counter+1
}

weektrend <- data.frame("Year"=year(scldtrend$datetime),
                        "RelativeWeek"=(epiweek(scldtrend$datetime) - scldtrend$DSTweek),
                        "WeeklyIncidence"=scldtrend$scldIncidenceperWEEK,
                        "AtRisk"=reltrend$AtRiskperWEEK)
#Calculate approximate "rate ratio" relative to DST
for(i in min(weektrend$Year):max(weektrend$Year)) {
    DSTinc <- mean(weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == 0 & weektrend$Year == i),"WeeklyIncidence"])
    #Even though getting mean DST incidence, it can be verified that it's the same for any year: 
    print(summary(weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == 0 & weektrend$Year == i),]))
    weektrend[which(weektrend$Year == i),"RateRatio"] <- weektrend[which(weektrend$Year == i),"WeeklyIncidence"]/DSTinc
}
#Removing duplicate entries (should be the case for each week to have n duplicates, where n is the number of seizures that contributed to the incidence in that time period)...important to remove before outlier removal as different Ns per week will cause biased outlier removal
weektrend <- unique(weektrend)
#Eliminate spuriously extreme outliers (beyond 1st/99th percentiles)
weektrend <- weektrend[which(weektrend$RateRatio > quantile(weektrend$RateRatio, 0.01, na.rm=T)[[1]] & weektrend$RateRatio < quantile(weektrend$RateRatio, 0.99, na.rm=T)[[1]]),]
weekstats <- data.frame("RelativeWeek"=numeric(),
                        "Mean"=numeric(),
                        "SD"=numeric())

###PREVIOUS METHOD without weighted averages and SDs
#index=1
#for(i in min(weektrend$RelativeWeek):max(weektrend$RelativeWeek)) {
#    weekstats[index,"RelativeWeek"] <- i
#    weekstats[index,"Mean"] <- mean(weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == i),"RateRatio"])
#    weekstats[index,"SD"] <- sd(weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == i),"RateRatio"])#/nrow(weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == i),])
#    index=index+1
#}

index=1
for(i in min(weektrend$RelativeWeek):max(weektrend$RelativeWeek)) {
    weekstats[index,"RelativeWeek"] <- i
    #Creating a weighted average and weighted SD
    WA <- weighted.mean(weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == i),"RateRatio"], weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == i),"AtRisk"])
    weekstats[index,"Mean"] <- WA
    WSD <- sqrt(sum(weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == i),"AtRisk"] * (weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == i),"RateRatio"] - WA)^2)/sum(weektrend[which(weektrend$RelativeWeek == i),"AtRisk"]))
    weekstats[index,"SD"] <- WSD
    index=index+1
}
```

```{r Diem vs Nocturnum rate ratio trends - scaled for individual yearly seizure counts}
    ylim(0.5,2.25) +

#Because first (1st) and last weeks (52nd or 53rd) can be partial weeks, will remove so as not to bias averages for given weekdays
diemtrend <- Day08to16[which(Sz08to16$weeknum > 1 & Sz08to16$weeknum < 52 & Sz08to16$overnight == 0),]
nocttrend <- Night08to16[which(Sz08to16$weeknum > 1 & Sz08to16$weeknum < 52 & Sz08to16$overnight == 1),]
daytrend <- data.frame("Year"=year(diemtrend$datetime),
                       "RelativeDay"=(yday(diemtrend$datetime) - diemtrend$DSTday),
                       "DailyIncidence"=diemtrend$scldIncidenceperDAY,
                       "AtRisk"=diemtrend$AtRiskperDAY)
daytrend <- na.omit(daytrend)
nighttrend <- data.frame("Year"=year(nocttrend$datetime),
                         "RelativeDay"=(yday(nocttrend$datetime) - nocttrend$DSTday),
                         "DailyIncidence"=nocttrend$scldIncidenceperDAY,
                         "AtRisk"=nocttrend$AtRiskperDAY)
nighttrend <- na.omit(nighttrend)
#Calculate approximate "rate ratio" relative to DST
for(i in min(daytrend$Year):max(daytrend$Year)) {
    DSTinc <- mean(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == 0 & daytrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"])
    #Even though getting mean DST incidence, it can be verified that it's the same for any year: 
    print(summary(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == 0 & daytrend$Year == i),]))
    daytrend[which(daytrend$Year == i),"RateRatio"] <- DSTinc/daytrend[which(daytrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"]
}
for(i in min(nighttrend$Year):max(nighttrend$Year)) {
    DSTinc <- mean(nighttrend[which(nighttrend$RelativeDay == 0 & nighttrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"])
    #Even though getting mean DST incidence, it can be verified that it's the same for any year: 
    print(summary(nighttrend[which(nighttrend$RelativeDay == 0 & nighttrend$Year == i),]))
    nighttrend[which(nighttrend$Year == i),"RateRatio"] <- DSTinc/nighttrend[which(nighttrend$Year == i),"DailyIncidence"]
}
#Because each representation at a given day of the year contains the same incidence for that day, need to remove duplicates before removing outliers (can verify by checking dim of daytrend after outlier removal if unique is done before or after the outlier removal)
daytrend <- unique(daytrend)
#Eliminate spuriously extreme outliers (beyond 1st/99th percentiles)
daytrend <- daytrend[which(daytrend$RateRatio > quantile(daytrend$RateRatio, 0.01, na.rm=T)[[1]] & daytrend$RateRatio < quantile(daytrend$RateRatio, 0.99, na.rm=T)[[1]]),]
daystats <- data.frame("RelativeDay"=numeric(),
                       "Mean"=numeric(),
                       "SD"=numeric())

#Eliminate spuriously extreme outliers (beyond 1st/99th percentiles)
nighttrend <- nighttrend[which(nighttrend$RateRatio > quantile(nighttrend$RateRatio, 0.01, na.rm=T)[[1]] & nighttrend$RateRatio < quantile(nighttrend$RateRatio, 0.99, na.rm=T)[[1]]),]

index=1
for(i in min(daytrend$RelativeDay):max(daytrend$RelativeDay)) {
    daystats[index,"RelativeDay"] <- i
    #Creating a weighted average and weighted SD
    WA <- weighted.mean(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"], daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"])
    daystats[index,"Mean"] <- WA
    WSD <- sqrt(sum(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"] * (daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"RateRatio"] - WA)^2)/sum(daytrend[which(daytrend$RelativeDay == i),"AtRisk"]))
    daystats[index,"SD"] <- WSD
    index=index+1
}
index=1
for(i in min(nighttrend$RelativeDay):max(nighttrend$RelativeDay)) {

    nightstats[index,"SD"] <- WSD
    index=index+1
}
```

Seizure count comparisons by weekday  
#NOTE: iterated i=list[n] to generate baseline comparison on a weekday-to-weekday basis (e.g. compare Monday to Monday, Tuesday to Tuesday, etc.). This creates an apparent discrepancy of the weekday-to-weekday rate ratios seen in the figures BECAUSE, those rate ratios all have to be calculated in relation to a SINGLE baseline (the DST transition Sunday)  
```{r a function for comparing weekdays, defaulted comparison between DST and all non-DST}
compareweekdays <- function(firstweek=Sz08to16wkofDST,
                            secondweek=Sz08to16notDST,
                            wkone="week of DST",
                            wktwo="all non DST") {
    
    list <- c("Sunday","Monday","Tuesday","Wednesday","Thursday","Friday","Saturday")
    week2weekstats <- data.frame("Weekday"=character(),
                                 "DSTmean"=numeric(),
                                 "DSTsd"=numeric(),
                                 "COMPmean"=numeric(),
                                 "COMPsd"=numeric(),
                                 "FreqP"=numeric(),
                                 "FreqT"=numeric(),
                                 "Freqdf"=numeric(),
                                 "Freqd"=numeric(),
                                 "RateRatio"=numeric(),
                                 "lCI"=numeric(),
                                 "uCI"=numeric(),
                                 "RRP"=numeric(),
                                 "RRT"=numeric(),
                                 "RRdf"=numeric(),
                                 "RRd"=numeric(),
                                 stringsAsFactors = F)
    
    #Get firstweek's scaled data
    firstscld <- firstweek[,c("datetime","AtRiskperDAY","scldIncidenceperDAY")]
    firstscld$datetime <- as.Date(firstscld$datetime)
    firstscld <- unique(firstscld)
    names(firstscld)[1] <- "Var1"
    duplicated(firstscld) #no duplicated entries (confirms the AtRisk and scldIncidence values are correct)
    
    #Get secondweek's scaled data
    secondscld <- secondweek[,c("datetime","AtRiskperDAY","scldIncidenceperDAY")]
    secondscld$datetime <- as.Date(secondscld$datetime)
    secondscld <- unique(secondscld)
    names(secondscld)[1] <- "Var1"
    duplicated(secondscld) #no duplicated entries (confirms the AtRisk and scldIncidence values are correct)
    
    week2week <- data.frame("Weekday"=character(),
                            "Year"=numeric(),
                            "RateRatio"=numeric(),
                            stringsAsFactors = F)
    
    firstdf <- data.frame("Week"=character(),
                          "Weekday"=character(),
                          "Mean_Sz_count"=numeric(),
                          "sd"=numeric(),
                          "se"=numeric(),
                          stringsAsFactors = F)
    seconddf <- data.frame("Week"=character(),
                           "Weekday"=character(),
                           "Mean_Sz_count"=numeric(),
                           "sd"=numeric(),
                           "se"=numeric(),
                           stringsAsFactors = F)
    counter=1
    for(i in list) {
        #Get seizure counts for each day of the week in DST
        #-this is tabulated BY DATE (i.e. all Sz on Sunday 2008-03-16)
        #-this allows for independent t-tests (albeit suboptimal compared to paired t-tests)
        wkdayinDST <- firstweek[which(firstweek$wkday == i),"datetime"]
        fixedDSTSunday <- firstweek[which(firstweek$wkday == "Sunday"),"datetime"] #does NOT always needs to be DST
        wkdaycount <- table(as.Date(wkdayinDST)) #,'America/Los_Angeles' caused a problem for ST week
        fixedcount <- table(as.Date(fixedDSTSunday))
        wkdaycountdf <- as.data.frame(wkdaycount)
        fixedcountdf <- as.data.frame(fixedcount)
        wkdayscld <- wkdaycountdf
        fixedscld <- fixedcountdf
        wkdayscld$Var1 <- as.Date(as.POSIXct(as.character(wkdayscld$Var1)))
        fixedscld$Var1 <- as.Date(as.POSIXct(as.character(fixedscld$Var1)))
        wkdayscld <- merge.data.frame(x=wkdayscld,y=firstscld,all.x=T,sort=F)
        fixedscld <- merge.data.frame(x=fixedscld,y=firstscld,all.x=T,sort=F)
        
        #Get seizure counts for each day of the week not in DST
        #-this is tabulated BY DATE (i.e. all Sz on Sunday 2008-03-16)
        wkdaynonDST <- secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == i),"datetime"]
        wkdaycounts <- table(as.Date(wkdaynonDST)) #,'America/Los_Angeles' caused a problem for ST week
        wkdaycountsdf <- as.data.frame(wkdaycounts)
        wkday2scld <- wkdaycountsdf
        wkday2scld$Var1 <- as.Date(as.POSIXct(as.character(wkday2scld$Var1)))
        wkday2scld <- merge.data.frame(x=wkday2scld,y=secondscld,all.x=T,sort=F)
        
        ###WEIGHTED###
        weightedT <- wtd.t.test(wkday2scld$Freq,wkdayscld$Freq,wkday2scld$AtRiskperDAY,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY)
        week2weekstats[counter, "Weekday"] <- i
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"FreqT"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[1]]
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"Freqdf"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[2]]
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"FreqP"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[3]]
        print(weightedT)
        CohenD <- cohen.d(wkday2scld$Freq,wkdayscld$Freq)
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"Freqd"] <- CohenD$estimate[[1]]
        print(CohenD)
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"COMPmean"] <- wt.mean(as.numeric(wkday2scld$Freq),
                                                                                 as.numeric(wkday2scld$AtRiskperDAY))
        print(paste(i,wktwo,"Sz counts 2008-2016 weighted mean:",round(wt.mean(as.numeric(wkday2scld$Freq),
                                                                               as.numeric(wkday2scld$AtRiskperDAY)),2)))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"COMPsd"] <- wt.sd(as.numeric(wkday2scld$Freq),
                                                                             as.numeric(wkday2scld$AtRiskperDAY))
        print(paste(i,wktwo,"Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(wt.sd(as.numeric(wkday2scld$Freq),
                                                                  as.numeric(wkday2scld$AtRiskperDAY)),2)))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"DSTmean"] <- wt.mean(wkdayscld$Freq,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY)
        print(paste(i,wkone,"Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(wt.mean(wkdayscld$Freq,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY),2)))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"DSTsd"] <- wt.sd(wkdayscld$Freq,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY)
        print(paste(i,wkone,"Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(wt.sd(wkdayscld$Freq,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY),2)))
        
        wkday4merge <- wkdayscld
        #wkday4merge <- fixedscld
        wkday24merge <- wkday2scld
        wkday4merge$Var1 <- year(wkday4merge$Var1)
        wkday24merge$Var1 <- year(wkday24merge$Var1)
        #x is second week, y is first week (flipped)
        wkdayMERGED <- merge.data.frame(wkday24merge,wkday4merge,by.x="Var1",by.y="Var1",all.x=T)
        wkdayMERGED$RateRatio <- wkdayMERGED$scldIncidenceperDAY.y/wkdayMERGED$scldIncidenceperDAY.x #Rate Ratio from first week (usually DST)/second week (usually comparison week)
        
        baselinerisk <- rep(1,nrow(wkdayscld))
        #baselinerisk <- rep(1,nrow(fixedscld))
        
        weightedT <- wtd.t.test(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,baselinerisk,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY)
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RRT"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[1]]
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RRdf"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[2]]
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RRP"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[3]]
        print(weightedT)
        CohenD <- cohen.d(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,baselinerisk)
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RRd"] <- CohenD$estimate[[1]]
        print(CohenD)
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"] <- wt.mean(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)
        print(paste(i,"mean rate ratio of",wkone,"to",wktwo,":",wt.mean(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)))
        print(paste(i,"SD rate ratio of",wkone,"to",wktwo,":",wt.sd(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"lCI"] <- wt.mean(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)-1.96*wt.sd(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)/sqrt(length(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$Weekday == i),"uCI"] <- wt.mean(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)+1.96*wt.sd(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)/sqrt(length(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio))
        print(paste(i,"95% CI of rate ratio of",wkone,"to",wktwo,":",
                    round(wt.mean(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)-1.96*wt.sd(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)/sqrt(length(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio)),2),
                    "to",
                    round(wt.mean(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)+1.96*wt.sd(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio,wkdayMERGED$AtRiskperDAY.x)/sqrt(length(wkdayMERGED$RateRatio)),2)))
        
        firstdf[counter,"Week"] <- wkone
        firstdf[counter,"Weekday"] <- i
        firstdf[counter,"Mean_Sz_count"] <- wt.mean(wkdayscld$Freq,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY)
        firstdf[counter,"sd"] <- wt.sd(wkdayscld$Freq,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY)
        firstdf[counter,"se"] <- wt.sd(wkdayscld$Freq,wkdayscld$AtRiskperDAY)/sqrt(nrow(wkdayscld))
        
        seconddf[counter,"Week"] <- wktwo
        seconddf[counter,"Weekday"] <- i
        seconddf[counter,"Mean_Sz_count"] <- wt.mean(wkday2scld$Freq,wkday2scld$AtRiskperDAY)
        seconddf[counter,"sd"] <- wt.sd(wkday2scld$Freq,wkday2scld$AtRiskperDAY)
        seconddf[counter,"se"] <- wt.sd(wkday2scld$Freq,wkday2scld$AtRiskperDAY)/sqrt(nrow(wkday2scld))
        
        ##Need a week2week for raw data to put into geom_boxplot
        FORweek2week <- data.frame("RateRatio"=wkdayMERGED$RateRatio)
        FORweek2week$"Weekday" <- i
        FORweek2week$"Year" <- wkdayMERGED$Var1
        FORweek2week <- FORweek2week[,c(2,3,1)]
        week2week <- rbind(week2week,FORweek2week)
        
        counter=counter+1
    }
    
    write.table(week2weekstats,
                file = paste("week2week_weekdaySTATS_",wkone,"_",wktwo,".txt",sep=""),
```

Weekly comparisons  
#Note: Rate Ratios are calculated as DST incidence/other week incidence (thus RR > 1 => increased risk of seizures in DST, relative to the comparison)  
```{r weekly comparisons}
#Find out what week DST is in, register to that then calculate
#If wanting to do comparison to the every-non-DST-week baseline, then second week must be Sz08to16nonDST/"all non DST"
compareweeks <- function(firstweek=Sz08to16wkofDST,
                         secondweek=Sz08to16notDST,
                         wkone="week of DST",
                         wktwo="all non DST") {
    
    #Get seizure counts for the week in DST
    #-this allows for independent t-tests (albeit suboptimal compared to paired t-tests)
    DSTweekCount <- as.data.frame(table(year(firstweek$datetime)))
    DSTweekNum <- DSTweekCount
    DSTweekNum$Var1 <- as.numeric(seq(from=min(year(firstweek$datetime)),to=max(year(firstweek$datetime)))) #need to make numeric
    DSTweekWeights <- data.frame("Var1"=numeric(),
                                 "Weights"=numeric())
    #generate average weekly counts of AtRisk, for weighted averages
    counter=1
    for(i in min(as.numeric(DSTweekNum$Var1)):max(as.numeric(DSTweekNum$Var1))){
        DSTweekWeights[counter,"Var1"] <- i
        DSTweekWeights[counter,"Weights"] <- mean(firstweek[which(year(firstweek$datetime) == i),"AtRiskperWEEK"])
        counter=counter+1
    }
    
    week2weekstats <- data.frame("epoch"=character(),
                                 "DSTmean"=numeric(),
                                 "DSTsd"=numeric(),
                                 "COMPmean"=numeric(),
                                 "COMPsd"=numeric(),
                                 "FreqP"=numeric(),
                                 "FreqT"=numeric(),
                                 "Freqdf"=numeric(),
                                 "Freqd"=numeric(),
                                 "RateRatio"=numeric(),
                                 "lCI"=numeric(),
                                 "uCI"=numeric(),
                                 "RRP"=numeric(),
                                 "RRT"=numeric(),
                                 "RRdf"=numeric(),
                                 "RRd"=numeric(),
                                 stringsAsFactors = F)
    
    if(identical(secondweek,Sz08to16notDST)) { #For the all-non-DST-weeks-as-baseline comparison
        #Get seizure counts for week(s) not in DST
        NONweekdf <- secondweek[,c("datetime","weeknum","DSTweek")]
        NONweekdf <- NONweekdf[-which(NONweekdf$weeknum == NONweekdf$DSTweek),] #ensures no DST-week counts are included
        NONweekdf$year <- year(NONweekdf$datetime)
        table(NONweekdf$weeknum,NONweekdf$year)
        NONweekCount <- as.data.frame(table(NONweekdf$weeknum,NONweekdf$year))
        NONweekCount[NONweekCount == 0] <- NA #replace non-existing weeks (e.g. year without the 53rd week, DST)
        
        #T-tests (x is for week of DST, y is for comparison week(s)):
        print(t.test(DSTweekCount$Freq,NONweekCount$Freq))
        NONweekNum <- NONweekCount
        #Need to make the week number and year numeric
        NONweekNum$Var1 <- as.numeric(levels(NONweekNum$Var1))[NONweekNum$Var1]
        NONweekNum$Var2 <- as.numeric(levels(NONweekNum$Var2))[NONweekNum$Var2]
        
        NONweekWeights <- data.frame("Var1"=numeric(),
                                     "Var2"=numeric(),
                                     "Weights"=numeric())
        #generate average weekly counts of AtRisk, for weighted averages
        counter=1
        for(i in min(as.numeric(NONweekNum$Var2)):max(as.numeric(NONweekNum$Var2))){
            for(j in min(as.numeric(NONweekNum$Var1)):max(as.numeric(NONweekNum$Var1))){
                NONweekWeights[counter,"Var1"] <- j
                NONweekWeights[counter,"Var2"] <- i
                NONweekWeights[counter,"Weights"] <- mean(secondweek[which(year(secondweek$datetime) == i & epiweek(secondweek$datetime) == j),"AtRiskperWEEK"])
                counter=counter+1
            }

        #print(paste("All DST Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(wt.sd(DSTweekCount$Freq,DSTweekWeights$Weights),2)))
        
        week2week <- data.frame("Year"=numeric(),
                                "DSTSzcount"=numeric(),
                                "DSTatrisk"=numeric(),
                                "DSTincidence"=numeric(),
                                "NONSzcount"=numeric(),
                                "NONatrisk"=numeric(),
                                "NONincidence"=numeric(),
                                "RateRatio"=numeric())
        counter=1
        for(i in min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)):max(year(Sz08to16$datetime))) {
            #Subsetting for the year of interest
            thisyear <- Sz08to16[which(year(Sz08to16$datetime) == i),]
            firstyear <- firstweek[which(year(firstweek$datetime) == i),]
            secondyear <- secondweek[which(year(secondweek$datetime) == i),]
            
            #Try using denominator estimated by number of individuals recording through the end of the period of interest
            firstdenomdf <- Sz08to16[which(Sz08to16$datetime <= as.Date(max(firstyear$datetime))),"Unlinked_ID"]
            firstdenom <- length(unique(firstdenomdf))
            seconddenomdf <- Sz08to16[which(Sz08to16$datetime <= as.Date(max(secondyear$datetime))),"Unlinked_ID"]
            seconddenom <- length(unique(seconddenomdf))
            print(paste("Rough estimate of difference in 'at risk' individuals: ",abs(firstdenom-seconddenom),"; with ",firstdenom," accumulated individuals by DST week of ",i,sep=""))
            
            week2week[counter,"Year"] <- i
            #week2week[counter,"DSTSzcount"] <- DSTweekCount[which(DSTweekCount$Var1 == i),"Freq"]
            #week2week[counter,"DSTatrisk"] <- firstdenom
            #week2week[counter,"DSTincidence"] <- week2week[counter,"DSTSzcount"]/week2week[counter,"DSTatrisk"]
            #week2week[counter,"NONSzcount"] <- NONweekCount[which(NONweekCount$Var1 == i),"Freq"]
            #week2week[counter,"NONatrisk"] <- seconddenom
            #week2week[counter,"NONincidence"] <- week2week[counter,"NONSzcount"]/week2week[counter,"NONatrisk"]
            #week2week[counter,"RateRatio"] <- week2week[counter,"DSTincidence"]/week2week[counter,"NONincidence"]
            week2week[counter,"DSTSzcount"] <- DSTweekCount[which(DSTweekCount$Var1 == i),"Freq"]
            week2week[counter,"DSTatrisk"] <- mean(firstweek[which(year(firstweek$datetime) == i),"AtRiskperWEEK"])
            week2week[counter,"DSTincidence"] <- mean(firstweek[which(year(firstweek$datetime) == i),"scldIncidenceperWEEK"])
            week2week[counter,"NONSzcount"] <- NONweekCount[which(NONweekCount$Var1 == i),"Freq"]
            week2week[counter,"NONatrisk"] <- mean(secondweek[which(year(secondweek$datetime) == i),"AtRiskperWEEK"])
            week2week[counter,"NONincidence"] <- mean(secondweek[which(year(secondweek$datetime) == i),"scldIncidenceperWEEK"])
            week2week[counter,"RateRatio"] <- week2week[counter,"DSTincidence"]/week2week[counter,"NONincidence"]
            counter=counter+1
            
        }
        baselinerisk=rep(1,length(week2week$RateRatio)) #As DST is the reference, we're comparing to this
        ###WAS NOT WEIGHTED###
        #print(t.test(week2week$RateRatio,baselinerisk))
        #print(cohen.d(week2week$RateRatio,baselinerisk))
        #print(paste(wktwo,"rate ratios 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(week2week$RateRatio),2)))
        #print(paste(wktwo,"rate ratios 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(week2week$RateRatio),2)))
        #print(paste(wktwo,
        #            "rate ratio conidence interval:",
        #            round(mean(week2week$RateRatio)-1.96*sd(week2week$RateRatio)/sqrt(length(week2week$RateRatio)),2),
        #            "to",
        #            round(mean(week2week$RateRatio)+1.96*sd(week2week$RateRatio)/sqrt(length(week2week$RateRatio)),2)))
        
        ###WEIGHTED###
        weightedT <- wtd.t.test(week2week$NONSzcount,week2week$DSTSzcount,week2week$NONatrisk,week2week$DSTatrisk)
        week2weekstats[1, "epoch"] <- wktwo

        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"Freqdf"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[2]]
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"FreqP"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[3]]
        print(weightedT)
        CohenD <- cohen.d(week2week$NONSzcount,week2week$DSTSzcount)
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"Freqd"] <- CohenD$estimate[[1]]
        print(CohenD)
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"COMPmean"] <- wt.mean(as.numeric(week2week$NONSzcount),
                                                                                   as.numeric(week2week$NONatrisk))

                                                                                   as.numeric(week2week$NONatrisk)),2)))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"COMPsd"] <- wt.sd(as.numeric(week2week$NONSzcount),
                                                                               as.numeric(week2week$NONatrisk))
        print(paste("All",wktwo,"Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(wt.sd(as.numeric(week2week$NONSzcount),
                                                                      as.numeric(week2week$NONatrisk)),2)))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"DSTmean"] <- wt.mean(week2week$DSTSzcount,week2week$DSTatrisk)
        print(paste("All",wkone,"Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(wt.mean(week2week$DSTSzcount,week2week$DSTatrisk),2)))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"DSTsd"] <- wt.sd(week2week$DSTSzcount,week2week$DSTatrisk)

        weightedT <- wtd.t.test(week2week$RateRatio,baselinerisk,week2week$NONatrisk,week2week$DSTatrisk)
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"RRT"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[1]]
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"RRdf"] <- weightedT$coefficients[[2]]

        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"RateRatio"] <- wt.mean(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)
        print(paste("Mean of rate ratio of",wkone,"to",wktwo,":",wt.mean(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)))
        print(paste("SD of rate ratio of",wkone,"to",wktwo,":",wt.sd(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"lCI"] <- wt.mean(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)-1.96*wt.sd(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)/sqrt(length(week2week$RateRatio))
        week2weekstats[which(week2weekstats$epoch == wktwo),"uCI"] <- wt.mean(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)+1.96*wt.sd(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)/sqrt(length(week2week$RateRatio))
        print(paste("95% CI of rate ratio of",wkone,"to",wktwo,":",
                    round(wt.mean(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)-1.96*wt.sd(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)/sqrt(length(week2week$RateRatio)),2),
                    "to",
                    round(wt.mean(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)+1.96*wt.sd(week2week$RateRatio,week2week$NONatrisk)/sqrt(length(week2week$RateRatio)),2)))
        
        write.table(week2weekstats,
                    file = paste("week2week_fullweekSTATS_",wkone,"_",wktwo,".txt",sep=""),
                    quote = F,
                    row.names = F)
        
        write.table(week2week,
                    file=paste("Seizure Rate Ratios for ",wkone," compared to ",wktwo,".txt",sep=""),
                    quote = F,
                    row.names = F)
        week2week$Year <- as.factor(week2week$Year)
        
        #Now plot the rate ratios, by year
        print(ggplot(week2week[,c("Year","RateRatio")], aes(x=Year, y=RateRatio)) + 
            #IF WANT AS HISTOGRAM:
            #geom_bar(position=position_dodge(), stat="identity",
            #         colour="black", # Use black outlines,
            #         size=.3) +      # Thinner lines
            geom_point(size=5, color="turquoise4") + 
            geom_hline(yintercept = mean(week2week$RateRatio)) + 
            geom_hline(yintercept = c(mean(week2week$RateRatio)+1.96*sd(week2week$RateRatio),
                                      mean(week2week$RateRatio)-1.96*sd(week2week$RateRatio)),
                       linetype=3) + 
            scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0.5,1.5)) + 
            xlab("Year") +
            ylab("Rate Ratio") +
            ggtitle(paste(wkone,"vs",wktwo,"Rate Ratios from",min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)),"to",max(year(Sz08to16$datetime)))) +
            theme_bw())
        png(paste(wkone," vs ",wktwo," Rate Ratios from ",min(year(Sz08to16$datetime))," to ",max(year(Sz08to16$datetime)),".png",sep=""), 
            width = 9, 
            height = 6, 
            units = 'in', 
            bg = "transparent", 
            res = 300)
        print(ggplot(week2week[,c("Year","RateRatio")], aes(x=Year, y=RateRatio)) + 
            #IF WANT AS HISTOGRAM:
            #geom_bar(position=position_dodge(), stat="identity",
            #         colour="black", # Use black outlines,
            #         size=.3) +      # Thinner lines
            geom_point(size=5, color="turquoise4") + 
            geom_hline(yintercept = mean(week2week$RateRatio)) + 
            geom_hline(yintercept = c(mean(week2week$RateRatio)+1.96*sd(week2week$RateRatio),
                                      mean(week2week$RateRatio)-1.96*sd(week2week$RateRatio)),
                       linetype=3) + 
            scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0.5,1.5)) + 
            xlab("Year") +
            ylab("Rate Ratio") +
            ggtitle(paste(wkone,"vs",wktwo,"Rate Ratios from",min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)),"to",max(year(Sz08to16$datetime)))) +
            theme_bw())
        dev.off()
    }
}
```

```{r scratchpad, eval=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
    #Get seizure counts for each day of the week not in DST
    #-this is tabulated BY DATE (i.e. all Sz on Sunday 2008-03-16)
    SUNnonDST <- secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == "Sunday"),"datetime"]
    SUNcounts <- table(as.Date(SUNnonDST))
    SUNcountsdf <- as.data.frame(SUNcounts)
    MONnonDST <- secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == "Monday"),"datetime"]
    MONcounts <- table(as.Date(MONnonDST))
    MONcountsdf <- as.data.frame(MONcounts)
    TUEnonDST <- secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == "Tuesday"),"datetime"]
    TUEcounts <- table(as.Date(TUEnonDST))
    TUEcountsdf <- as.data.frame(TUEcounts)
    WEDnonDST <- secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == "Wednesday"),"datetime"]
    WEDcounts <- table(as.Date(WEDnonDST))
    WEDcountsdf <- as.data.frame(WEDcounts)
    THUnonDST <- secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == "Thursday"),"datetime"]
    THUcounts <- table(as.Date(THUnonDST))
    THUcountsdf <- as.data.frame(THUcounts)
    FRInonDST <- secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == "Friday"),"datetime"]
    FRIcounts <- table(as.Date(FRInonDST))
    FRIcountsdf <- as.data.frame(FRIcounts)
    SATnonDST <- secondweek[which(secondweek$wkday == "Saturday"),"datetime"]
    SATcounts <- table(as.Date(SATnonDST))
    SATcountsdf <- as.data.frame(SATcounts)
    
    #T-tests (x is for weekdays in DST, y is for comparison weeks):
    print(SunT <- t.test(SUNcount,SUNcounts))
    print(cohen.d(as.data.frame(SUNcount)$Freq,as.data.frame(SUNcounts)$Freq))
    print(paste(wkone,"Sunday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(SUNcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wkone,"Sunday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(SUNcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Sunday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(SUNcounts)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Sunday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(SUNcounts)$Freq),2)))
    
    print(MonT <- t.test(MONcount,MONcounts))
    print(cohen.d(as.data.frame(MONcount)$Freq,as.data.frame(MONcounts)$Freq))
    print(paste(wkone,"Monday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(MONcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wkone,"Monday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(MONcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Monday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(MONcounts)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Monday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(MONcounts)$Freq),2)))
    
    print(TueT <- t.test(TUEcount,TUEcounts))
    print(cohen.d(as.data.frame(TUEcount)$Freq,as.data.frame(TUEcounts)$Freq))
    print(paste(wkone,"Tuesday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(TUEcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wkone,"Tuesday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(TUEcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Tuesday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(TUEcounts)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Tuesday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(TUEcounts)$Freq),2)))
    
    print(WedT <- t.test(WEDcount,WEDcounts))
    print(cohen.d(as.data.frame(WEDcount)$Freq,as.data.frame(WEDcounts)$Freq))
    print(paste(wkone,"Wednesday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(WEDcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wkone,"Wednesday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(WEDcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Wednesday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(WEDcounts)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Wednesday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(WEDcounts)$Freq),2)))
    
    print(ThuT <- t.test(THUcount,THUcounts))
    print(cohen.d(as.data.frame(THUcount)$Freq,as.data.frame(THUcounts)$Freq))
    print(paste(wkone,"Thursday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(THUcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wkone,"Thursday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(THUcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Thursday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(THUcounts)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Thursday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(THUcounts)$Freq),2)))
    
    print(FriT <- t.test(FRIcount,FRIcounts))
    print(cohen.d(as.data.frame(FRIcount)$Freq,as.data.frame(FRIcounts)$Freq))
    print(paste(wkone,"Friday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(FRIcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wkone,"Friday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(FRIcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Friday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(FRIcounts)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Friday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(FRIcounts)$Freq),2)))
    
    print(SatT <- t.test(SATcount,SATcounts))
    print(cohen.d(as.data.frame(SATcount)$Freq,as.data.frame(SATcounts)$Freq))
    print(paste(wkone,"Saturday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(SATcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wkone,"Saturday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(SATcount)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Saturday Sz counts 2008-2016 mean:",round(mean(as.data.frame(SATcounts)$Freq),2)))
    print(paste(wktwo,"Saturday Sz counts 2008-2016 SD:",round(sd(as.data.frame(SATcounts)$Freq),2)))
    
    #Getting person-count approximate denominators and incidence rates for each day
    # -note this denominator of person-time is inaccurate for multiple reasons:
    #  +it counts people "at risk" only if they've documented a seizure - i.e. ascertainment bias for those reporting
    #  +it doesn't account for single documenters that then stop using the app - also an ascertainment bias
    #  +it doesn't account for interventions (i.e. surgery, changes in regimen), assuming similar risk over similar time periods
    #  +it doesn't account for "voyeurs" - people who signed up, but haven't documented yet
    
    #Creating list of count data frames
    l.df <- lapply(ls(pattern="[A-Z]countdf"), function(x) get(x))
    l.df <- append(l.df, lapply(ls(pattern="[A-Z]countsdf"), function(x) get(x)))
    #Getting names of environmental variables to name the list elements
    DSTnames <- ls(pattern="[A-Z]countdf")
    NONnames <- ls(pattern="[A-Z]countsdf")
    listnames <- c(DSTnames,NONnames)
    names(l.df) <- listnames
    
    for(i in listnames) {
        #This will add in the relevant data
        for(j in 1:nrow(l.df[[i]])) {
            denomdf <- Sz08to16[which(Sz08to16$datetime <= as.Date(l.df[[i]][j,"Var1"])),"Unlinked_ID"]
            l.df[[i]][j,"AtRisk"] <- length(unique(denomdf))
            l.df[[i]][j,"Incidence"] <- l.df[[i]][j,"Freq"]/length(unique(denomdf))
        }
    }
    
    #For each non-DST data frame add in DST variables and calculate Rate Ratios
    for(i in NONnames) {
        DST4NON <- grep(paste("^",substr(i,1,3),sep=""),DSTnames,value=T) #Get name of comparable DST week
        for(j in 1:nrow(l.df[[i]])) { #Iterate over dates in non-DST data frame
            for(k in 1:nrow(l.df[[DST4NON]])) { #Iterate over dates in DST data frame to add comparisons to non-DST data frame
                if(year(l.df[[i]][j,"Var1"]) == year(l.df[[DST4NON]][k,"Var1"])) { 
                    l.df[[i]][j,"DSTFreq"] <- l.df[[DST4NON]][k,"Freq"] 
                    l.df[[i]][j,"DSTAtRisk"] <- l.df[[DST4NON]][k,"AtRisk"] 
                    l.df[[i]][j,"DSTIncidence"] <- l.df[[DST4NON]][k,"Incidence"] 
                }
            }
        }
        l.df[[i]][,"RateRatio"] <- l.df[[i]][,"DSTIncidence"]/l.df[[i]][,"Incidence"] #Calculate Rate Ratios
    }
    
    #Put the new data frames back into the Global Environment
    list2env(l.df,envir=.GlobalEnv)
    
    week2week <- data.frame("Weekday"=character(),
                            "Year"=numeric(),
                            "RateRatio"=numeric(),
                            stringsAsFactors = F)
    
    for(i in list) {
        weekdaydf <- grep(paste("^",substr(i,1,3),sep=""),NONnames,value=T,ignore.case=T)
        for(j in min(year(Sz08to16$datetime)):max(year(Sz08to16$datetime))) {
            FORweek2week <- data.frame("RateRatio"=l.df[[weekdaydf]][which(year(as.Date(l.df[[weekdaydf]][,"Var1"])) == j),"RateRatio"])
            FORweek2week$"Weekday" <- i
            FORweek2week$"Year" <- j
            FORweek2week <- FORweek2week[,c(2,3,1)]
            week2week <- rbind(week2week,FORweek2week)
        }
    }
    
    DSTbaseline=rep(1,max(week2week$Year)-min(week2week$Year)+1)
    for(i in list) {
        print(t.test(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"],DSTbaseline))
        print(cohen.d(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"],DSTbaseline))
        print(paste(wktwo,i,"rate ratios 2008-2016 mean:",
                    round(mean(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"]),2)))
        print(paste(wktwo,i,"rate ratios 2008-2016 SD:",
                    round(sd(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"]),2)))
        print(paste(wktwo,
                    i,
                    "rate ratio conidence interval:",
                    round(mean(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"])-1.96*sd(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"])/sqrt(length(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"])),2),
                    "to",
                    round(mean(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"])+1.96*sd(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"])/sqrt(length(week2week[which(week2week$Weekday == i),"RateRatio"])),2)))
    }
```

Just another bit of fun looking at the data from an autocorrelation perspective (based on Coursera: Practical Time Series Analaysi)  
```{r autocorrelation analysis with Yule-Walker}
forTS <- Sz08to16[,c("datetime","FreqperDAY")]
forTS$datetime <- as.Date(forTS$datetime,tz='America/Los_Angeles')
#just a check that the Freq per day is all the same:
forTS[which(forTS$datetime == "2008-05-16"),]
uTS <- unique(forTS)
head(uTS)
uoTS <- uTS[order(uTS$datetime),]
head(uoTS)
ts08to16 <- ts(uoTS$FreqperDAY)
plot(ts08to16, main=paste("Seizure frequencies from",
                          min(uoTS$datetime),
                          "to",
                          max(uoTS$datetime)),
     col='blue', lwd=1)
#that spike is so completely unrealistic...check it out
uoTS[which(uoTS$FreqperDAY > 4*sd(uoTS$FreqperDAY) & year(uoTS$datetime) == 2011),"FreqperDAY"] <- NA 
#mean(uoTS[which(year(uoTS$datetime) == 2011),"FreqperDAY"]) #replaced with mean Sz counts for the year
###Alternatively: can replace with NAs and then pass na.action=na.pass as an alternative strategy
ts08to16 <- ts(uoTS$FreqperDAY)
plot(ts08to16, main=paste("Seizure frequencies from",
                          min(uoTS$datetime),
                          "to",
                          max(uoTS$datetime)),
     col='blue', lwd=1)
#much more believable...may have biased the other data

#Assess if there is autocorrelation:
Box.test(ts08to16, lag=log(length(ts08to16)))
#p<0.05 (or whatever threshold chosen) is suggestive of autocorrelation

plot(diff(ts08to16) ~ uoTS$datetime[1:(nrow(uoTS)-1)], type="l", main="Differenced series", ylab='', xlab='')
#should the diff be applied to log-transformed data? - yes, because of non-stationary trend over time.
plot(diff(log(ts08to16)) ~ uoTS$datetime[1:(nrow(uoTS)-1)], type="l", main="Differenced series", ylab='', xlab='')
#Looks a bit better with log transform
#Do we need to diff for seasonality? - nope, as the close inspection of the differenced log data doesn't appear to have seasonality:
plot(diff(log(ts08to16)) ~ uoTS$datetime[1:(nrow(uoTS)-1)], type="l", main="Differenced series", ylab='', xlab='', xlim=c(14500,15000))

Box.test(diff(log(ts08to16)), lag=log(length(diff(ts08to16))))

acf(diff(log(ts08to16)), main="ACF of differenced data", na.action = na.pass, 50)
pacf(diff(log(ts08to16)), main="PACF of differenced data", na.action = na.pass, 50)

#ARIMA modeling
d=1 #Need to figure out how many difference measures to include...1 is appropriate as the single difference seemed to mitigate any non-stationarity
pickarima <- data.frame("ARp"=numeric(),
                        "diff"=numeric(),
                        "MAq"=numeric(),
                        "AIC"=numeric(),
                        "SSE"=numeric(),
                        "pval"=numeric())
index=1
for(p in 1:7){ #can pick the range of Ps after examining the PACF plot
    for(q in 1:2){ #can pick the range of Qs after examining the ACF plot
        if(p+d+q<=10){ 
            model<-arima(x=ts08to16, order = c((p-1),d,(q-1)))
            pval<-Box.test(model$residuals, lag=log(length(model$residuals)))
            sse<-sum((model$residuals[!is.na(model$residuals)])^2)
            cat(p-1,d,q-1, 'AIC=', model$aic, ' SSE=',sse,' p-VALUE=', pval$p.value,'\n')
            pickarima[index,"ARp"] <- p-1
            pickarima[index,"diff"] <- d
            pickarima[index,"MAq"] <- q-1
            pickarima[index,"AIC"] <- model$aic
            pickarima[index,"SSE"] <- sse
            pickarima[index,"pval"] <- pval$p.value
        }
        index=index+1
    }
}

arima(diff(log(ts08to16)), order=c(pickarima[which(pickarima$AIC == min(pickarima$AIC)),"ARp"],
                                   pickarima[which(pickarima$AIC == min(pickarima$AIC)),"diff"],
                                   pickarima[which(pickarima$AIC == min(pickarima$AIC)),"MAq"]))

#log-return of the data, given the trend
ts08to16.log.return=diff(log(ts08to16))
ts08to16.log.return.mean.zero=ts08to16.log.return-mean(ts08to16.log.return,na.rm = T)

# Plots for log-returns
par(mfrow=c(3,1))
plot(ts08to16.log.return.mean.zero, main=paste("Log-return (mean zero) of seizure frequencies from",
                                               min(uoTS$datetime),
                                               "to",
                                               max(uoTS$datetime)))
acflim <- acf(ts08to16.log.return.mean.zero, main='ACF', na.action=na.pass, plot = F)
ordinate <- sort(abs(acflim$acf), TRUE)[2] #finding first-order autocorrelation (0-order is always 1)
acf(ts08to16.log.return.mean.zero, main='ACF', na.action=na.pass, ylim=c(-ordinate, ordinate))
pacf(ts08to16.log.return.mean.zero, main='PACF', na.action=na.pass)

# Order, based on the parial autocorrelation plot; choose the most parsimonious model (ie first drop into the noise range)
p=6
print("Note the optimal autocorrelation lag at about 1 week, and with harmonics about every 7 days")

# sample autocorreleation function r
r=NULL
r[1:p]=acf(ts08to16.log.return.mean.zero, na.action=na.pass, plot=F)$acf[2:(p+1)]
r

# matrix R
R=matrix(1,p,p) # matrix of dimension p by p, with entries all 1's.

# define non-diagonal entires of R
for(i in 1:p){
    for(j in 1:p){
        if(i!=j)
            R[i,j]=r[abs(i-j)]
    }
}
R

# b-column vector on the right
b=matrix(r,p,1)# b- column vector with no entries
b

phi.hat=solve(R,b)[,1]
phi.hat

# Variance estimation using Yule-Walker Estimator
c0=acf(ts08to16.log.return.mean.zero, na.action=na.pass, type='covariance', plot=F)$acf[1]
c0
var.hat=c0*(1-sum(phi.hat*r))
var.hat

# Constant term in the model
phi0.hat=mean(ts08to16.log.return, na.rm=T)*(1-sum(phi.hat))
phi0.hat

cat("Constant:", phi0.hat," Coeffcients:", phi.hat, " and Variance:", var.hat, '\n')

#SARIMA modeling (adding in seasonality)
d=1 #Need to figure out how many difference measures to include...1 is appropriate as the single difference seemed to mitigate any non-stationarity
DD=1 #Need to figure out how many SEASONAL difference measures to include...1 is appropriate as the single difference seemed to mitigate any non-stationarity

per=4 #What is the period of the seasonality...I would believe it's ~365 days (can inspect plots and look at the other seasonality papers from this data set and other seizure multi-dien papers)

for(p in 1:2){
  for(q in 1:2){
    for(i in 1:2){
      for(j in 1:2){
        if(p+d+q+i+DD+j<=10){
          model<-arima(x=log(ts08to16),
                       order = c((p-1),d,(q-1)),
                       seasonal = list(order=c((i-1), DD, (j-1)), period=per))
          pval<-Box.test(model$residuals, lag=log(length(model$residuals)))
          sse<-sum(model$residuals^2)
          cat(p-1,d,q-1,i-1,DD,j-1,per, 'AIC=', model$aic, ' SSE=',sse,' p-VALUE=', pval$p.value,'\n')
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```
